head.title: Nina Blumenthal, A Doctor, Is Wed

hedline.hl1: Nina Blumenthal, A Doctor, Is Wed

block.p: LEAD: Dr. Nina Carol Blumenthal, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph W. Blumenthal of Southfield, Mich., was married yesterday to Dr. Scott M. Corin, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Corin of Roslyn Harbor, L.I. Rabbi Lane Steinger performed the ceremony at the Northfield Hilton Hotel in Troy, Mich.

LEAD: Dr. Nina Carol Blumenthal, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph W. Blumenthal of Southfield, Mich., was married yesterday to Dr. Scott M. Corin, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Corin of Roslyn Harbor, L.I. Rabbi Lane Steinger performed the ceremony at the Northfield Hilton Hotel in Troy, Mich.

Dr. Nina Carol Blumenthal, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph W. Blumenthal of Southfield, Mich., was married yesterday to Dr. Scott M. Corin, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Corin of Roslyn Harbor, L.I. Rabbi Lane Steinger performed the ceremony at the Northfield Hilton Hotel in Troy, Mich.

The bride, a resident in dermatology at the Wayne State University affiliated hospitals, graduated cum laude from the University of Michigan and received her medical degree from the University of Michigan Medical School. Her father, who is retired, owned and operated the Lafayette Radio Electronics stores in Michigan. Her mother, Nancy Blumenthal, is a teacher at the Gibson School for the Gifted in Radford, Mich.

Dr. Corin graduated magna cum laude from Brown University and is an alumnus of the New York University School of Medicine. He is completing a residency in ophthalmology at the Kellogg Eye Center at the University of Michigan. His father is a civil engineer in Roslyn Harbor, where he is also a Village Trustee. His mother, Lucy Corin, teaches mathematics at the John F. Kennedy High School in Bellmore, L.I.
